description: The first issue of Buster after merging with Cor!!.
200th issue.

He came out of thin air, without any memory at all, but he showed he's a natural born fighter. The people from the “Dusk City” have no doubt: the mysterious warrior called Kur-jak is the hero the old legends talk about, the men who can end the long siege posed by the Obscures. At the head of the Shinings, accompanied by Princess Xeethra's love, the hero will have to face the dangerous pilgrimage through the “Tenebrous Plain”, confront the Furious Giants, the Dark Serpents, the Radiant Meteors, the Absorbers and the other terrifying representers of the Evil Forces. But someone else arrived in this dark world at the end of time: someone ready to interfere with Kur-Jak's mission to bring him back home...
name: Alla ricerca di Kurjak

description:
Only issue dated for a two-month span rather then a single month.

April/May 1997
Although the cover dates the issue for May 1997, this is likely an error and it is indexed as June 1997 seeing as the previous issues is April-May and the following issue is July.

Since the times of Marco Polo, people whispered in fear the name of the “telesmat”, the illusory black magic that captures the fools who dare enter the endless sandy realm of the Taklamakan. A great Swedish explorer, Sven Hedin, barely managed to escape death among the desert's arid dunes and, according to a dark legend, he met a terrible and powerful creature there... A camel-mounted Uighur expedition, joined by Harlan, Tesla, Kurjak and Matthew Shady, ventures inside the dangerous desert to search for a mysterious lost city whose whereabouts weren't revealed by Hedin in his books. But two powerful criminal syndicates are on their tracks: the “Blue Wolves” and the “Blue Dragon Triad”. They all hope to find, under the sand, Draka and his “hidden kingdom”. Having guessed his projects, Harlan wants to kill his father... And Martin De Vere aims to give Draka's hidden power on the world back to his new and enigmatic patron...
name: Gli spettri del Taklamakan

description: Between the coast of Brittany to the streets of Paris, between the Boulevard du Crime during the 1850s, to the Latin Quarter where Victor's anarchic bookstore is, Harlan Draka is about to live one of the strangest adventures of his risky life! He will lose his body and gain a new soul. His memories and dreams become entangled with those of a long-deceased poet: Gèrard de Nerval, writer of “Les Chimères” and “Les Filles du Feu”. Harlan will find out that one of the female ghosts the dreaming poet loved so much, really was a dangerous vampire... She's not the real threat, though: two old enemies – a man and a woman who have power on dreams, magic and time – are scheming against Harlan...
name: Le figlie del fuoco

description: After arriving in Prague to meet Harlan, Hanneke, the gorgeous Flemish policewoman, hopes to have a relation with him and – just like the good detective she is – to uncover the secret of his dangerous life. But she chose the wrong time. Immortal Sonderling, Nergal's infernal police officer, is back in Mala Strana to settle the score with the Dampyr once and for all. His first move will be to isolate him... Hanneke is trapped, Kurjak kidnapped by the lethal Dama Druj and Tesla seduced by charming Samael. While, along with Caleb Lost, Harlan is about to face the all-powerful Hell Princes, his last ally fails him as well, since Caleb is brought to court in front of the inappellable Tribunal of the Law...
name: La maledizione di Sinistrari

description: While Caleb and Anyel face the judgment of the Tribunal of the Law, a hard task awaits Harlan and Nikolaus: they’ll have to save Hanneke, imprisoned by the Vodnìk at the bottom of the Vltava River, and Kurjak, tortured by a horde of witches inside Sinistrari’s magic painting. And Tesla, seduced by Samael, is now passed to the Evil side... But Nergal and his minions will have to reckon with the Dampyr’s determination. New alliances, double-crossings and unexpected turn of events lead to the final clash, beyond the black walls of the infernal city, against the Demon Princes...
name: I principi dell’Inferno

description: Reprints Archie's The Mighty Crusaders #5.
Reprints Marvel's Avengers #60.

WildStorm's seminal super heroes, The Paladins, are in for a rough day when they discover that the Apocalypse has begun! But how does a secret from WildStorm's troubled past hold the key to a nightmarish tomorrow?
name: TPB

description: Reprints King's Flash Gordon #5, with art by Al Williamson.
Reprints Charlton's Out of this World #1. The comic's title becomes Creepy World rather than Creepy Worlds in order to re-use part of the cover text from the original comic.
Reprints Charlton's Unusual Tales #29. Contents and cover will be re-used for Creepy Worlds #152 and #186.
Reprints Charlton's Unusual Tales #29, which had already been reprinted in Creepy Worlds #40, and would be re-used again for Creepy Worlds #186.
name: The Bus Was Flying

description: Reprints Charlton's Unusual Tales #29, which had already been reprinted twice by Alan Class, once in Creepy Worlds #40 and again in Creepy Worlds #152.
name: Where Does It Go?

description: Cover mistakenly reads October 1997, actually November.

name: Iron Man!
Who Needs You? ; Secret of the Hidden Planet ; Prisoner of the Wizard

description:
1. A Day at the Circus

2. Heathcliff Goes Hollywood

name: How Do You Catch a Ghost?

description: The lead story is Fantastic Four #1 the remainder are Charlton Steve Ditko stories.
